questions.question: What is the first key component of the delegation process?
Which of the following best describes delegation?
What distinguishes delegation from assigning work?

options.a: Delegation involves empowerment and decision-making authority
options.b: Assigning work involves empowerment and decision-making authority
options.d: There is no difference between delegation and assigning work

questions.question: Which of the following is a factor to consider when delegating work?

options.b: The time available for the task

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of delegation?

options.a: To transfer full responsibility to subordinates
options.b: To empower subordinates and improve efficiency
options.c: To minimize the role of managers
options.d: To reduce workload for managers only

questions.question: What element of delegation involves allowing a subordinate to make decisions within their responsibilities?
Which of the following is NOT a benefit of delegation?

options.a: Develops leadership and competencies in subordinates
options.d: Improves the overall functioning of the organization

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of effective delegation?

options.a: A manager assigns a task but does not provide resources or authority
options.b: A manager provides clear instructions, authority, and resources to a subordinate
options.c: A manager does everything themselves without involving subordinates
options.d: A manager assigns a task but does not check in on progress

questions.question: What is one key characteristic of a manager's role in delegation?

options.a: Managers should delegate everything to their subordinates
options.b: Managers retain accountability even when tasks are delegated
options.c: Managers should avoid giving subordinates authority
options.d: Managers should delegate all strategic decisions

questions.question: How does delegation benefit the organization?

options.a: It reduces the number of employees needed
options.b: It prevents burnout and encourages team performance
options.c: It reduces the need for manager involvement
options.d: It limits decision-making to senior leaders
